Review Text: Oh, what can I say?  I grew up on Star Trek, and I guess it will always be one of my favorites.  The characters are enjoyable with their unique personalities.  They always face insurmountable challenges, but find a way out.
Review Title: One of my favorites
Rating: 5.0

One of my favorite movies
Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
Gene Wilder  (Actor),     Jack Albertson  (Actor),     Mel Stuart  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Spotlight Deals, Mother's Day Gift Ideas in Movies & TV
['Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory 40th Anniversary Edition (DVD)', 'Celebrate the 40th Anniversary of a musical fantasy for the young, and the young at heart. The mysterious candy maker extraordinaire Willy Wonka (Gene Wilder) hides a Golden Ticket inside five of his famous candy bars. The kids who find them are invited on a grand tour of the wondrous, wacky Wonka factory, and a chance for an even grander prize -- if they can resist temptation. The delightful musical score includes the hit song "The Candyman." From Roald Dahl\'s classic novel, produced by David Wolper ("Roots," "The Thorn Birds") and nominated for an Academy Award.', ']]>']

I like both versions of Willy Wonka because they each offer something a little different.  Both have basically the same great story.  Being a chocoholic myself, who wouldn't want to own a candy factory?
One of my favorite movies
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Zoltan Korda'], 'Producers': ['Alexander Korda'], 'Starring': ['John Clements', 'Ralph Richardson', 'C. Aubrey Smith'], 'Studio': ['The Criterion Collection']}
This is a great story of courage.  We will not always be understood by others.  It is most important that we understand ourselves.  In doing so, we will be better able to understand and love others.
One of my favorite movies

Although I don't like foul language at all, I am very offended by the cursing that references our Savior.  I didn't realize there was so much of it because it is edited out when watching these on network TV.  I so enjoy the action and comedy between the two characters.  Too bad it is ruined by the cursing.  I only got through Rush Hour, and that with great difficulty.
I miss the language editing for TV

I was interested in the concept of surviving a nuclear disaster.  Unfortunately, it doesn't seem very true to life as far as the damaging effects would go, and somehow there is plenty of food for everyone to eat.  As the season moves on, it becomes more of a typical soap opera.  I lost interest about half-way through.
Interesting concept

Interesting Watch

profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user maintains a strong preference for films and series that emphasize family values, humor, and complex familial relationships. Their interest in historically-themed narratives with witty dialogue continues, alongside a fondness for whimsical musical fantasies and educational programming.

- **Humor Appreciation:** Light-hearted narratives are central to their viewing choices, maintained by an impressive average rating of 4.7. They seek authentic storytelling that skillfully balances maturity with sensitivity, favoring joyful and reflective comedy.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user recently rated a beloved series 5.0, reflecting their continued interest in character-driven stories that resonate with personal nostalgia. Their previous rating of a historical show at 4.0 indicates a flexible approach to ratings, emphasizing quality dialogue while remaining sensitive to graphic content.

- **Content Sensitivity:** The user remains sensitive to overly negative themes, demonstrating a preference for tasteful humor. Their concerns with political interjections in historical narratives have not diminished their enjoyment of thoughtful content.

- **Language & Accessibility:** They prioritize English-language media and value accessibility features, such as audio descriptions and closed captions.

- **Director & Actor Affinity:** The user shows loyalty to directors and actors who create emotionally rich narratives. Their recent interactions reaffirm their appreciation for classic ensemble casts and character dynamics, coupled with a critical yet appreciative stance on the historical content they consume.
